publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3013 David Mundell: Queen of the South: Second Division Champions-That the Parliament congratulates the players, manager, board, staff and supporters of Queen of the South Football Club not only for having achieved promotion to the First Division but also for securing the Second Division championship; recognises that the team's achievements over the past season have served as a tremendous psychological boost for the whole area, particularly in the aftermath of the foot-and-mouth disease crisis, and wishes the team and everyone associated with the club well in their endeavours in the First Division.

S1M-3013 Queen of the South: Second Division Champions (lodged on 22 April 2002) Phil Gallie*, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*, Murdo Fraser*, Mary Scanlon*, John Scott*, Mr Murray Tosh*, Alasdair Morgan*, Mr David Davidson*
S1M-3013 Queen of the South: Second Division Champions (lodged on 22 April 2002) Alex Fergusson*, Michael Russell*, John Young*, Mr Brian Monteith*, Mr Keith Harding*
S1M-3013 Queen of the South: Second Division Champions (lodged on 22 April 2002) Bill Aitken*, Alex Johnstone*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*

S1M-3013 David Mundell: Queen of the South: Second Division Champions-That the Parliament congratulates the players, manager, board, staff and supporters of Queen of the South Football Club not only for having achieved promotion to the First Division but also for securing the Second Division championship; recognises that the team's achievements over the past season have served as a tremendous psychological boost for the whole area, particularly in the aftermath of the foot-and-mouth disease crisis, and wishes the team and everyone associated with the club well in their endeavours in the First Division. Supported by: Phil Gallie, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Murdo Fraser, Mary Scanlon, John Scott, Mr Murray Tosh, Alasdair Morgan, Mr David Davidson, Alex Fergusson, Michael Russell, John Young, Mr Brian Monteith, Mr Keith Harding, Bill Aitken, Alex Johnstone, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton
S1M-3013 Queen of the South: Second Division Champions (lodged on 22 April 2002) Mr Jamie Stone*
S1M-3013 Queen of the South: Second Division Champions (lodged on 22 April 2002) Tommy Sheridan*
